issues.description: The Rideable interface in the solution defines messageOnRide(String equipment), but the problem statement (and UML) specify messageOnRide() with no parameters. This mismatch will confuse students when implementing and using the interface (e.g., Main.java invokes messageOnRide() without arguments).
issues.suggested_fix: Change the Rideable interface (and its implementations in Pig and Seal) to declare messageOnRide() without parameters, removing the equipment argument to match the problem description and UML.

issues.description: The Rideable interface in the solution repository defines messageOnRide(String equipment), but the problem statementâ€™s UML specifies a parameterless messageOnRide():String method. This signature mismatch prevents students from directly mapping the problem requirements to the provided solution and will cause compilation errors if they follow the spec.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the Rideable interface in the solution to declare String messageOnRide() without parameters, matching the UML and problem description.
